c74object.name: ears.fft~
c74object.description: Apply the Fast Fourier Transform or its inverse to a buffer

inlet.digest: Buffer containing input magnitudes or real (x) parts
inlet.description: Depending on the object "polar" attribute, the first inlet expects a buffer containing either the incoming magnitudes, or the incoming real parts of the samples

inlet.digest: Buffer containing input phases or imaginary (y) parts
inlet.description: Depending on the object "polar" attribute, the second inlet expects a buffer containing either the incoming phases (in the angleunit coordinate), or the incoming imaginary parts of the samples

outlet.digest: Buffer containing output magnitudes or real (x) parts
Buffer containing output phases (in the angleunit coordinate) or imaginary (y) parts

method.name: list/llll
method.description: A list or llll with buffer names will trigger the buffer processing and output the processed buffer names (depending on the naming attribute).

attribute.name: fullspectrum
attribute.description: Output full spectrum; if not set, it will output the first half of the spectrum only.

attribute.name: inv
attribute.description: Perform the inverse FFT, instead of the direct one.

attribute.name: polarin
attribute.description: Input data in polar coordinates, instead of cartesian ones. Default is 0.

attribute.name: polarout
attribute.description: Output data in polar coordinates, instead of cartesian ones. Default is 1.

attribute.name: unitary
attribute.description: Toggles the unitary normalization of the Fourier Transform (so that the if coincides with its inverse up to conjugation).

entry.name: Inlet 1 (symbol)
entry.description: Buffer containing input magnitudes or real (x) parts. Depending on the object "polar" attribute, the first inlet expects a buffer containing either the incoming magnitudes, or the incoming real parts of the samples

entry.name: Inlet 2 (symbol)
entry.description: Buffer containing input phases or imaginary (y) parts. Depending on the object "polar" attribute, the second inlet expects a buffer containing either the incoming phases (in the angleunit coordinate), or the incoming imaginary parts of the samples

entry.name: Outlet 1 (symbol)
entry.description: Buffer containing output magnitudes or real (x) parts.

entry.name: Outlet 2 (symbol)
entry.description: Buffer containing output phases (in the angleunit coordinate) or imaginary (y) parts.
